components.name: API Governance
components.description: Ensure APIs conform to governance standards while enabling speed to market.  Anypoint API Governance ensures consistent API quality and security with self-service tools.

components.name: Anypoint Partner Manager v2
components.description: Anypoint Partner Manager v2 accelerates customer adoption of B2B integrations by enabling easy configuration and management of their B2B flows

scheduled_maintenances.name: Anypoint Platform Release and Maintenance Window

incident_updates.body:
On Saturday, July 20, 2024 between 9AM and 2PM PDT (12PM - 5PM EDT, 4PM - 9PM UTC)
Customer Impacting / Downtime Announcement(s)
*** ATTENTION: up to 60 minutes of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window ***
We will be performing a scheduled update Vulnerability Remediation of an internal database for email notifications *** Service impact details: ** Applications: Runtime Manager API Manager Composer CloudHub During maintenance downtime: * User Experience(UX): Email notification system will be unavailable.
*** ATTENTION: up to 60 minutes of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window ***
We will be performing a scheduled upgrade of an internal database for Anypoint Secrets Manager *** Service impact details: * Applications: - Runtime Manager - API Manager - Partner Manager - Anypoint Security (All components) - Design Center (API Designer and Design Center Projects) - Anypoint Monitoring - MuleSoft Composer During maintenance downtime: * User Experience(UX): Anypoint Secrets Manager will be unavailable. User will experience an error for the following applications: Anypoint Secrets Manager: Customers will not be able to manage secret groups and secrets. Runtime Manager: Customers will not be able to deploy a new mule application, create a new Runtime Fabric instance, Private Space instance and Tokenization Service. API Manager: Customers will not be able to add or update APIs using Mule Gateway or Flex Gateway. Partner Manager: Customers will not be able to create or update endpoints, nor they will be able to deploy new message flows. Also they won’t be able to run template upgrades. Anypoint Security: Customers will not be able to create or update their security-edge instance and tokenization service. Design Center: Customers will not be able to perform activities involving Anypoint Secrets Manager. Anypoint Monitoring: Customers monitors that are using Anypoint Secrets Manager integration in their monitor will fail. MuleSoft Composer: Customers will not be able to activate flows. Existing flows may also be impacted if it stores or retrieves secrets from Secrets Manager. * API calls: Invoking Anypoint APIs that use Anypoint Secrets Manager will fail. * Existing Runtimes: are not impacted. * Following maintenance downtime: Anypoint Secrets Manager will function as usual
*** ATTENTION: up to 45 minutes service interruption is expected during this maintenance window ***
We will be performing a scheduled upgrade on part of the platform's underlying public key infrastructure. *** Service impact details: * Applications: - Runtime Fabric and CH2 spaces - Anypoint Monitoring - Flex Gateway - RPA During maintenance downtime: * Runtimes: are not impacted. * User Experience(UX): 1. Existing Runtime Fabric agents cannot rotate the PKI certificate. New Runtime Fabric installation cannot be created. 2. Anypoint monitoring agent will not be able to renew its mTLS certificate. There is no impact to the usage of existing mTLS certificate to ship the metrics to the Anypoint platform, unless the certificate expires during the maintenance window. 3. mTLS certificate for existing Flex Gateway instances cannot be renewed. Existing Flex Gateway instances cannot be deleted. New Flex Gateway instance cannot be created. 4. RPA manager will only be affected if its multi-tenant infrastructure needs to be expanded to fulfill a new provisioning request during the maintenance window. * API calls: API calls will not be impacted.
*** ATTENTION: up to 10 minutes of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window ***
We will be doing a scheduled upgrade on part of the platform underlying infrastructure. *** Service Impact Details: * Applications: - RPA Runtime During maintenance downtime: - RPA Runtime No data loss is expected for any tenant. Execution of RPA processes may fail intermittently as the infrastructure upgrade is in progress. Following maintenance downtime: - RPA Runtime will resume normal operations.
*** ATTENTION: up to 5 minutes of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window ***
We will be performing an update to the certificates of each Access Management database. *** Service Impact Details: ** Applications: - Access Management - Help Center During maintenance downtime, the following may fail: - API calls to Access Management - Logging into Anypoint Platform - Creating or updating organizations - Inviting or updating users - Creating or updating teams - Creating or updating environments - Configuring or updating multi-factor authentication - Configuring or updating identity providers - Creating or updating connected apps - Creating access tokens - Authorizing permissions and resources - Authenticating clients and access tokens - Getting organization information - Getting user profiles - Mule Gateway: There may be errors in customer logs and disconnections, but gateways will continue serving traffic. Following maintenance downtime - Access Management will function as usual - Help Center will function as usual Additionally, the following services may be impacted and in degraded states during this change. It is recommended that customers treat the following services as degraded during this window: - AMF Service - Anypoint Metering - Anypoint Monitoring - Anypoint MQ - API Analytics - API Designer - API Functional Monitoring - API Manager - API Mocking Service - API Monitoring Center - Audit Log - Design Center Projects - Mule Gateway - Object Store V2 - Runtime Manager - Anypoint Visualizer
*** ATTENTION: up to 60 minutes of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window ***
We will be doing a scheduled upgrade on part of the platform underlying infrastructure. *** Service Impact Details: * Applications: - MuleSoft Composer During maintenance downtime: - Composer UI will be intermittently inaccessible including Flow editor and Run History. Activating new flows may fail intermittently. Following maintenance downtime: - Composer functionality will resume normal operations.
*** ATTENTION: up to 60 minutes of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window ***
We will be performing database maintenance. *** Service Impact Details: ** Applications: Usage Reports (Metering) During Maintenance Downtime: User Experience(UX): Anypoint Platform users may not be able to view their Usage Reports. Usage will continue to be collected. Following maintenance downtime: Anypoint Platform users will be view their Usage Reports as usual
*** ATTENTION: up to 1 minute of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window ***
We will be performing OS Patching. *** Service Impact Details: ** Applications: - Repository Master During Maintenance Downtime: - The Repository Master will be undergoing maintenance. You may see issues retrieving non-cached artifacts from remote artifact repositories. - There are no functional changes.
*** ATTENTION: up to 90 minutes of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window ***
We will be performing a scheduled upgrade on part of the platform's underlying infrastructure. *** Service impact details: * Applications: - Runtime Manager This interruption affects only Standalone Servers. Runtime Fabric, Cloud Hub 2.0, Flex Gateway are not impacted. During the service interruption, there will be no impact to the applications. During maintenance downtime: * Runtimes: are not impacted. * User Experience(UX): For customers using Hybrid Standalone, application management capabilities of Runtime Manager may be disrupted as some servers may be disconnected and become unavailable for management. This will be temporary and the correct state of the mule application will be reflected after the maintenance window has been completed. * API calls: API calls will not be impacted * Logs and Data: log and metric display data will be updated during the service interruption.

incident_updates.body:
On Saturday, July 20, 2024 between 9AM and 2PM PDT (12PM - 5PM EDT, 4PM - 9PM UTC)
Customer Impacting / Downtime Announcement(s)
*** ATTENTION: up to 60 minutes of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window ***
We will be performing a scheduled update Vulnerability Remediation of an internal database for email notifications *** Service impact details: ** Applications: Runtime Manager API Manager Composer CloudHub During maintenance downtime: * User Experience(UX): Email notification system will be unavailable.
*** ATTENTION: up to 60 minutes of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window ***
We will be performing a scheduled upgrade of an internal database for Anypoint Secrets Manager *** Service impact details: * Applications: - Runtime Manager - API Manager - Partner Manager (both v1 and v2) - Anypoint Security (All components) - Design Center (API Designer and Design Center Projects) - Anypoint Monitoring - MuleSoft Composer During maintenance downtime: * User Experience(UX): Anypoint Secrets Manager will be unavailable. User will experience an error for the following applications: Anypoint Secrets Manager: Customers will not be able to manage secret groups and secrets. Runtime Manager: Customers will not be able to deploy a new mule application, create a new Runtime Fabric instance, Private Space instance and Tokenization Service. API Manager: Customers will not be able to add or update APIs using Mule Gateway or Flex Gateway. Partner Manager: Customers will not be able to create or update endpoints, nor they will be able to deploy new message flows. Also they won’t be able to run template upgrades. Anypoint Security: Customers will not be able to create or update their security-edge instance and tokenization service. Design Center: Customers will not be able to perform activities involving Anypoint Secrets Manager. Anypoint Monitoring: Customers monitors that are using Anypoint Secrets Manager integration in their monitor will fail. MuleSoft Composer: Customers will not be able to activate flows. Existing flows may also be impacted if it stores or retrieves secrets from Secrets Manager. * API calls: Invoking Anypoint APIs that use Anypoint Secrets Manager will fail. * Existing Runtimes: are not impacted. * Following maintenance downtime: Anypoint Secrets Manager will function as usual
*** ATTENTION: up to 45 minutes service interruption is expected during this maintenance window ***
We will be performing a scheduled upgrade on part of the platform's underlying public key infrastructure. *** Service impact details: * Applications: - Runtime Fabric and CH2 spaces - Anypoint Monitoring - Flex Gateway - RPA During maintenance downtime: * Runtimes: are not impacted. * User Experience(UX): 1. Existing Runtime Fabric agents cannot rotate the PKI certificate. New Runtime Fabric installation cannot be created. 2. Anypoint monitoring agent will not be able to renew its mTLS certificate. There is no impact to the usage of existing mTLS certificate to ship the metrics to the Anypoint platform, unless the certificate expires during the maintenance window. 3. mTLS certificate for existing Flex Gateway instances cannot be renewed. Existing Flex Gateway instances cannot be deleted. New Flex Gateway instance cannot be created. 4. RPA manager will only be affected if its multi-tenant infrastructure needs to be expanded to fulfill a new provisioning request during the maintenance window. * API calls: API calls will not be impacted.
*** ATTENTION: up to 10 minutes of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window ***
We will be doing a scheduled upgrade on part of the platform underlying infrastructure. *** Service Impact Details: * Applications: - RPA Runtime During maintenance downtime: - RPA Runtime No data loss is expected for any tenant. Execution of RPA processes may fail intermittently as the infrastructure upgrade is in progress. Following maintenance downtime: - RPA Runtime will resume normal operations.
*** ATTENTION: up to 5 minutes of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window ***
We will be performing a scheduled upgrade of an internal Access Management database. *** Service Impact Details: ** Applications: - Access Management - Help Center During maintenance downtime, the following may fail: - API calls to Access Management - Logging into Anypoint Platform - Creating or updating organizations - Inviting or updating users - Creating or updating teams - Creating or updating environments - Configuring or updating multi-factor authentication - Configuring or updating identity providers - Creating or updating connected apps - Creating access tokens - Authorizing permissions and resources - Authenticating clients and access tokens - Getting organization information - Getting user profiles - Anypoint MQ: If an existing token expires, the MQ Connector may experience HTTP 5XX errors for a few minutes, particularly if Access Management returns 5XX errors during the upgrade. - Mule Gateway: There may be errors in customer logs and disconnections, but gateways will continue serving traffic. Following maintenance downtime - Access Management will function as usual - Help Center will function as usual Additionally, the following services may be impacted and in degraded states during this change. It is recommended that customers treat the following services as degraded during this window: - AMF Service - Anypoint Metering - Anypoint Monitoring - Anypoint MQ - API Analytics - API Designer - API Functional Monitoring - API Manager - API Mocking Service - API Monitoring Center - Audit Log - Design Center Projects - Mule Gateway - Object Store V2 - Runtime Manager - Anypoint Visualizer
*** ATTENTION: up to 60 minutes of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window ***
We will be doing a scheduled upgrade on part of the platform underlying infrastructure. *** Service Impact Details: * Applications: - MuleSoft Composer During maintenance downtime: - Composer UI will be intermittently inaccessible including Flow editor and Run History. Activating new flows may fail intermittently. Following maintenance downtime: - Composer functionality will resume normal operations.
*** ATTENTION: up to 60 minutes of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window ***
We will be performing database maintenance. *** Service Impact Details: ** Applications: Usage Reports (Metering) During Maintenance Downtime: User Experience(UX): Anypoint Platform users may not be able to view their Usage Reports. Usage will continue to be collected. Following maintenance downtime: Anypoint Platform users will be view their Usage Reports as usual
*** ATTENTION: up to 1 minute of service interruption is expected during this maintenance window ***
We will be performing OS Patching. *** Service Impact Details: ** Applications: - Repository Master During Maintenance Downtime: - The Repository Master will be undergoing maintenance. You may see issues retrieving non-cached artifacts from remote artifact repositories. - There are no functional changes.

components.name: Anypoint Partner Manager v2

scheduled_maintenances.name: Anypoint Platform Release and Maintenance Window

incident_updates.body:
The regularly scheduled maintenance and release window for 03 August will not be occurring at this time. There is no expected impact to any MuleSoft services or infrastructure during the usual window.

The next maintenance window 15/17 August will proceed as planned.
